text.0: to agni i present a newer mightier hymn i bring my words and song unto the son of strength.
text.1: who offspring of the waters bearing precious things sits on the earth in season dear invoking priest.
text.2: soon as he sprang to birth that agni was shown forth to mātariśvan in the highest firmament.
text.3: when he was kindled through his power and majesty his fiery splendour made the heavens and earth to shine.
text.4: his flames that wax not old beams fair to look upon of him whose face is lovely shine with beauteous sheen.
text.5: the rays of agni him whose active force is light through the nights glimmer sleepless ageless like the floods.
text.6: send thou with hymns that agni to his own abode who rules one sovran lord of wealth like varuṇa.
text.7: him allpossessor whom the bhṛgus with their might brought to earths central point the centre of the world.
text.8: he whom no force can stay even as the maruts roar like to a dart sent forth even as the bolt from heaven.
text.9: agni with sharpened jaws chews up and eats the trees and conquers them as when the warrior smites his foes.
text.10: and will not agni find enjoyment in our praise will not the vasu grant our wish with gifts of wealth.
text.11: will not the inspirer speed our prayers to gain their end him with the radiant glance i laud with this my song.
text.12: the kindler of the flame wins agni as a friend promoter of the law whose face is bright with oil.
text.13: inflamed and keen refulgent in our gatherings he lifts our hymn on high clad in his radiant hues.
text.14: keep us incessantly with guards that cease not agni with guards auspicious very mighty.
text.15: with guards that never slumber never heedless never beguiled o helper keep our children.
